notesStmt.note: The margin of folios 2v-10r and 430v embodies the Song of Songs, Ruth, Psalms 1-5 and the beginnings of Psalm 89. Samuel ben ...: inscribed with his name in the colophon as a later correction (folio 429v). See comment in the sale catalogue of Bibliotheca Sussexiana, , according to which this manuscript 'has been taken out of the Vatican by Junot.' The Reverand Theodore Williams of Hendon, c. 1824: his motto Deus alit me ('God sustains me') above his armorial shield of a fess, 3 crescents, 3 birds, and a bird on top of the shield ([i verso]), and the monogram 'TW', and the motto ([i verso]).
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The Bible with masorah magna and parva, aka 'Duke of Sussex's Italian Bible'.

supportDesc.foliation: Unfoliated blank leaves after folio 12 and 448. Hebrew foliation from folio 13 starting with alef, that is, 1 until folio 124 (Hebrew folio 113). Hebrew foliation restarts on folio 125.

collation.p: 46 quires: i10 (folios 1-10), ii4 (folios 11-12b), iii-xii10 (folios 13-112), xiii12 (folios 113-124), xiv-xlii10 (folios 125-414), xliii8 (folios 415-422), xliv-10 (folios 423-432), xlveleven (folios 433-443), xlvisix (folios 444-[449]).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi square script, punctuated, of the 15th century.

decoDesc.decoNote: Floral borders inhabited by animals, coloured.
Floral borders inhabited by animals, coloured.

binding.p: Post-1600. Red morocco binding with gauffered edges, the arms and motto of Theodore Williams on the upper and lower covers.

history.provenance: Acquisition: Prince Augustus Frederick (b. 1773, d. 1843), Duke of Sussex: his armorial book-plate, inscribed (folio 451v); his sale 31 July 1844, lot 102: inscribed (folio 449v), purchased by the British Museum through Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849), for £34.10.
